intro: Navarretia multicaulis, commonly known as the Sierra Valley navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Navarretia multicaulis is adapted to seasonal climates and is an important component of local ecosystems.
